page.title: 10TARDIS POTTERY,HOOKWAY.
page.content: Mrs Rives-Roberts is the owner of Tardis Pottery in Hookway{(housed in a {garden shed}hidden away in this hamlet.)She uses plaster of paris moulds to produce some of her pieces and{fettling tools}and other things to make impressions in the clay.If she were using a wheel she would need different tools.To make impressions in the pots she uses clone tools. { The potter gets her casting clay from {America because she can't find any in {England of the quality she wants.} When decorating an article she can either use glazes or stains. She sells most of her pottery to three main shops,but shows her work at craft exhibitions and the library. Most potters have a style of their own and so does Mrs Rives-Roberts.She {concentrates on mugs,jugs and small {animals.
